rationale: No intensifier or comparative directly modifies a risk-adjective.
statement_text: The disease also spread rapidly in sea lions all along the Atlantic coast in August last year, killing thousands in areas where few birds were affected, suggesting the sea lions could transmit the virus, says Uhart.

rationale: The verb 'spread' is moderate. 'killing' is factual, not high-potency.
statement_text: The disease also spread rapidly in sea lions all along the Atlantic coast in August last year, killing thousands in areas where few birds were affected, suggesting the sea lions could transmit the virus, says Uhart.

rationale: The moderate verb 'spread' is paired with the scale/impact 'killing thousands'.
statement_text: The disease also spread rapidly in sea lions all along the Atlantic coast in August last year, killing thousands in areas where few birds were affected, suggesting the sea lions could transmit the virus, says Uhart.
